speech: No!

speaker: BOB
speech: Oh, wow look, that one is gorgeous. I would just kill for that one.

speaker: RAY
speech: Oh, not in blue. Blue does not go with all.

speaker: BOB
speech: Oh, please. Do you know what you're talking about? Because I don't think you know what you're talking about. Take a look at that.

speaker: KRAMER
speech: Excuse me.

speaker: RAY
speech: Are you talking to me?

speaker: KRAMER
speech: Uh, well, uh, we --

speaker: RAY
speech: I said, are you talking to me?

speaker: BOB
speech: Well, maybe, he was talking to me. Was you talking to him? Because you was obviously talking to one of us. So what is it? Who?! Who was you talking to?!

speaker: KRAMER
speech: Well, wha -- I, uh -- uh, we were kind of, uh, talking to each other, weren't we?

speaker: ELAINE
speech: I mean, you know, I've never been so insulted in my entire life. There's something really wrong with this man. He is a Soup Nazi. What? What is that?

speaker: JERRY
speech: I don't know. " 5 cups chopped Porcine mushrooms, half a cup of olive oil, 3 pounds of celery, chopped parsley..."

speaker: ELAINE
speech: Let me see this. [gasps] You know what this is? This is a recipe for soup, and look at this. There are like thirty different recipes. These are his recipes!

speaker: JERRY
speech: So?

speaker: ELAINE
speech: So? So, his secret's out. Don't you see? I could give these to every restaurant in town. I could have 'em published! I could - I could drop fliers from a plane above the city.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Wait a second, Elaine. Where do you think you're going?

speaker: ELAINE
speech: What do you care?

speaker: JERRY
speech: Elaine, I don't want you causing any trouble down at that soup stand. I happen to love that soup.

speaker: ELAINE
speech: Get out of my way, Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Elaine, let the man make his soup!

speaker: ELAINE
speech: Don't make me hurt you, Jerry.

speaker: SUSAN
speech: Look, they have it in blue...for my baby bluey. Are you my baby bluey?

speaker: GEORGE
speech: Oh, yes. I - I'm your baby bluey.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Well. Well.

speaker: SUSAN
speech: Hi, Jerry.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Hey, Susan, George.

speaker: SUSAN
speech: You know, I really like Sheila a lot.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Oh, really? Because we're kind of not seeing each other anymore.

speaker: SUSAN
speech: Oh, no! That's too bad.

speaker: JERRY
speech: Yeah. Well, she was very affectionate - which I love. You know I love that - but mentally, we couldn't quite make the connection.

speaker: GEORGE
speech: Really?

speaker: JERRY
speech: Yeah. Too bad, 'cause you gotta have the affection - which you obviously have. I think it's great that you're so open with your affections in public. See, we had that.

speaker: GEORGE
speech: You did?

speaker: JERRY
speech: Oh, yeah. But the mental thing. But anyway. I'll see ya.

speaker: GEORGE
speech: Yeah. See ya.

speaker: SOUP NAZI
speech: Go on! Leave! Get out!

speaker: WOMAN
speech: But I didn't do anything.

speaker: SOUP NAZI
speech: Next!

speaker: ELAINE
speech: Hello.

speaker: SOUP NAZI
speech: You. You think you can get soup? Please. You're wasting everyone's time.

speaker: ELAINE
speech: I don't want soup. I can make my own soup. " 5 cups chopped Porcine mushrooms, half a cup of olive oil, 3 pounds celery."

speaker: SOUP NAZI
speech: That is my recipe for wild mushroom.

speaker: ELAINE
speech: Yeah, that's right. I got 'em all. Cold cucumber, corn and crab chowder, mulligatawny.

speaker: SOUP NAZI
speech: Mulliga...tawny?

speaker: ELAINE
speech: You're through Soup Nazi. Pack it up. No more soup for you. Next!

speaker: NEWMAN
speech: [panting] Jerry! Jerry! Jerry!

speaker: JERRY
speech: What is it?

speaker: NEWMAN
speech: Something's happened with the Soup Nazi!

speaker: JERRY
speech: Wha - wha - what's the matter?

speaker: NEWMAN
speech: Elaine's down there causing all kinds of commotion. Somehow she got a hold of his recipes and she says she's gonna drive him out of business! The Soup Nazi said that now that his recipes are out, he's not gonna make anymore soup! He's moving out of the country, moving to Argentina! No more soup, Jerry! No more soup for any of us!

speaker: JERRY
speech: Well, where are you going?

speaker: NEWMAN
speech: He's giving away what's left! I gotta go home and get a big pot!
